From bug 91393:

It is possible that we can be looking up source in an external archive that 
gets closed underneath us. We maintain a central cache of source archives (zip 
files) used by all archive source containers. We heuristically close all 
archives when a process terminates, a launch is removed, a resource changes, 
etc. This is to prevent hanging onto open zip files after debugging is 
complete, and to prevent other file system operations to clash with an open 
zip file. However, the locking mechanism used allows a client to obtain a zip 
file, and then have it closed underneath them, before they are able to get the 
lock on the file.
